newsitem.title: GREECE: Greece to legalise thousands of illegal migrants.
newsitem.headline: Greece to legalise thousands of illegal migrants.

text.p: Greece will give thousands of illegal immigrants residence and work permits, the labour ministry said on Thursday.
"There are more than 400,000 illegal immigrants in Greece and if we don't take measures there will be around a million by the year 2000," Labour Minister Miltiadis Papaioannou told a news conference.
He said illegal migrants would have two months to submit applications to stay.
"Registering these people will be a very difficult task but we have to do something about it. The new law is based on similar ones in Italy, France and Portugal," he said.

The immigrants would be given a maximum nine-month work and residence permit free of charge. They would then be able to receive social security benefits but must also file tax statements, Papaioannou said.
Ministry officials told Reuters that when the initial permits expire, the immigrants would be granted new ones valid for up to five years.
"Only those immigrants who have the first permit will be eligible for the second. Those who don't apply will be considered illegal and will be immediately expelled," one official said.
Papaioannou said border patrols would be increased to stop aliens entering the country illegally.
Most illegal immigrants in Greece are from Albania and the Philippines. Many others come from Poland, Iraq, Bulgaria and the former Soviet republics.
Most of them clean houses or work on farms or in filling stations, restaurants and nightclubs to support families at home.
